newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Mauritius rupee stable vs dollar, firms vs stg.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius rupee stable vs dollar, firms vs stg.

text.p: The Mauritian rupee stabilised against the dollar and firmed against sterling on Friday due to both central bank intervention on Thursday and overnight trading on international markets, foreign exchange dealers said.
The rupee was fixed at an unchanged commercial mean rate of 20.4535 to the dollar and at a commercial mean rate of 33.2745 to the sterling from 33.6725 on Thursday.
"The central bank sold dollars in the interbank forex market on Thursday at the prevailing interbank rate," one dealer said.

The central bank intervention was also seen as providing support to the local currency after the rupee weakened by 15 cents against the dollar on Thursday under international market trends' pressure, dealers said.
They said commercial banks had no shortage of forex.
